task_1.eligibility_criteria: Vendors must possess a valid business license, demonstrate financial stability with at least two years of audited financial statements, and have prior experience supplying office materials to similar-sized companies. Certifications such as ISO 9001 for quality management are preferred.
task_1.submission_requirements: Bid proposals must be submitted in PDF format via the company’s procurement portal by the specified deadline. Required documents include a completed bid form, detailed pricing list, delivery schedule, and at least three client references. Late submissions will not be considered.
task_1.evaluation_criteria: Proposals will be evaluated based on cost (40%), quality of products (30%), delivery timeline (20%), and vendor reputation (10%). A scoring matrix will be used to ensure objectivity, with the highest-scoring bid awarded the contract.
task_1.conflict_of_interest_guidelines: All employees involved in the bid evaluation process must disclose any personal or financial relationships with vendors. Evaluators must sign a conflict-of-interest declaration, and any conflicts will result in recusal from the decision-making process.

task_2.needs_assessment: The hospital’s department heads must submit a formal request detailing the medical equipment needed, including specifications, intended use, and budget justification. Requests must be approved by the procurement committee and aligned with the hospital’s annual budget.
task_2.vendor_selection: The procurement team will issue a request for proposals (RFP) to pre-qualified vendors. Bids will be evaluated based on technical specifications, cost, warranty terms, and after-sales support. A shortlist of vendors will be invited for presentations.
task_2.purchase_approval: Purchases under $50,000 require approval from the department head and procurement manager. Purchases exceeding $50,000 must be approved by the hospital’s executive committee. All approvals must be documented and filed for audit purposes.
task_2.delivery_and_inspection: Upon delivery, the biomedical engineering team will inspect the equipment to ensure it meets the specified standards and is free from defects. A delivery acceptance report must be signed before payment is processed. All inspection records will be archived.
